channel.title: Decent mouse?
channel.description:
Hi,
[size=8pt][s]I'm looking to purchase a decent keyboard (£30 budget approx.)
I Have found this one: http://www.qfonic.com/gaming-gaming-saitek-cyborg-usb-gaming-keyboard-blackred-p-4866.html
Anyone know if saitek's are any good?
I want one with backlight keys.
Is their any cheap keyboards with lcd screen on it? [/s][/size] Need advice on a good mouse (Budget £20 or below).
Preferably for gaming.
Thanks

item.title: Decent mouse?
item.dc:creator: @cumescape cumescape
item.description:
@cumescape wrote:

[quote=“xEnt, post:24, topic:360760”]G15 is pretty good for overclocking, having the LCD display system temps, usage and FPS on the game your in is great.[/quote]They have software for that… You can have it right in the corner of your screen. Why do people like rice so god damn much… My fucking keyboard doesn’t need an LCD or a backlit keyboard…

Read full topic

item.title: Decent mouse?
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:17, topic:360760”]I use a rush fireglider for a mouse,

amazon.co.uk

Sharkoon Fireglider Laser Mouse: Amazon.co.uk: Computers & Accessories

Interfaces:1 x USB - 4 PIN USB Type A, Performance:Up to 45 inches per second, 3 ms response time, 7080 fps, 20 G maximum acceleration, realtime sensitivity switching600/800/1200/1600/2000/3600 dpi, M ...

never really liked the feel or shape of it but you do get used to it, and changing from 1200 dpi for desktop use to 3600 dpi with a button press is pretty fucking sweet.[/quote]
Adjustable weight? That’s crazy talk…

Read full topic

item.title: Decent mouse?
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:12, topic:360760”]I bought some £20 cherry wireless mouse/keyboard set when I got this pc a few years ago, the mouse was horrible(bad feel, tracking, covering started to wear off leaving small plastic ball shit everywhere) but the keyboard is still going strong to the point where all the a-z keys are shiny and some of the main ones(especially wasd) have paint wear on the lettering. 2 rechargeable 800mah aaa batteries last for MONTHS in it even with heavy typing.

Oh and it has a set of media and volume keys which are fucking perfectly positioned so you can mute in an instant as you’re parent or loved one walks in with your pants at your ankles.

amazon.co.uk

Cherry eVolution SIRIUS Wireless USB Keyboard and Mouse Black: Amazon.co.uk: Computers & Accessories

Completely uncomplicated and reliable, the Cherry eVolution SIRIUS Wireless MultiMedia Desktop requires no software installation or extensive installation procedure. The optical 5-button mouse is symm ...

Not quite what mine was called but it looks exactly the same.[/quote]FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF GET ON IRC

Read full topic

item.title: Decent mouse?
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

I got a g15 a few weeks ago, I wouldn’t usually spend that much but I thought I’d treat myself after using the same tomato-sauce drenched one for five years. It is very very good, having backlit keys is very nice, and the macro keys are sometimes usefull.

Anyways I’m not saying you must get it, but personally I find it very nice.

Read full topic

item.title: Decent mouse?
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

[quote=“I james I, post:1, topic:360760”]Hi,

I’m looking to purchase a decent keyboard (£30 budget approx.)

I Have found this one:
http://www.qfonic.com/gaming-gaming-saitek-cyborg-usb-gaming-keyboard-blackred-p-4866.html

Anyone know if saitek’s are any good?

I want one with backlight keys.

Is their any cheap keyboards with lcd screen on it?

Thanks[/quote]

saitek make alright keyboards, but if you want a decent keyboard that will last and be awesome go with the ones i linked. they are remakes of the ibm model m keyboard (unicomp owns the patent). the spacesaver is the same as the customizer, minus some extra casing (preference, but much better considering you “save” space and it still has the same feel).

an lcd is completely unnecessary. sure its a fun novelty, but that will wear off fast and cost you quite a bit. backlighting is an understandable preference but you really dont need it, i have found it to be more distracting anyway.

if your concern is gaming you might want to opt for a ‘gaming’ keyboard, im assuming you fit the generic casual gamer area. even then, the keyboards i linked are fine. the spacesaver was a bit awkward at first in css, but you get used to it quickly to the point where it is better than gaming with a mushy keyboard.

Read full topic

item.title: Decent mouse?
item.dc:creator: @cumescape cumescape
item.description:
@cumescape wrote:

Here you go.

Best keyboards ever made and will last you a lifetime (assuming we will be using PS/2 connections in the future);

en.wikipedia.org

Model M keyboard

Model M is a designation for a group of computer keyboards manufactured by IBM starting in 1984, and later by Lexmark, Unicomp and MaxiSwitch. The keyboard's many variations have their own distinct characteristics, with the vast majority having a buckling-spring key design and swappable keycaps. Model M keyboards have been praised by computer enthusiasts and frequent typists due to their durability and consistency, and the tactile and auditory feedback they provide. The Model M is also regarded a...

I want one with backlight keys.

Is their any cheap keyboards with lcd screen on it?

Get out of here with that rice…

Read full topic
